qas.question: What country does the local industry that manufactures fibre get their flax from?
What island was made a dependency of Saint Helena in 1922?
What was the name of the airport the United States built on Ascension Island?
What year was Wideawake Airport built?

context: A local industry manufacturing fibre from <a0_0>New Zealand<a0_0/> flax was successfully reestablished in 1907 and generated considerable income during the First World War. <a1_0>Ascension Island<a1_0/> was made a dependency of Saint Helena in 1922, and Tristan da Cunha followed in 1938. During the Second World War, the United States built <a2_0>Wideawake airport<a2_0/> on Ascension in <a3_0>1942<a3_0/>, but no military use was made of Saint Helena.
